intro: Ruckia brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved ruckia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Ruckia brevifolia is also valued for its ability to thrive in humid conditions with minimal maintenance.
